bug.short_desc: Opt-in (not opt-out) to dynamic locale and dynamic theme switches

long_desc.thetext:
Currently, the following two advanced features are configurable but enabled by default: dynamic runtime switching of locales (desktop and mobile) and of themes (desktop). Their environment keys are qx.dynlocale or qx.dyntheme, respectively.
As advanced features they come with a certain overhead for regular apps, which typically don't use those features. Thus they should be turned off by default, and the developer should opt-in to turn any of those on.
Related tasks, e.g. bug 7138 , bug 7099
Changing from opt-out to opt-in should be handled in a major release, i.e. qooxdoo 3.0, with appropriate release/migration notes.

Why should we disable these features by default if there is no penalty in modern browsers? If we want to change the default behavior of qx.dynlocale (qx.dyntheme hasn't been release jet) it has to have a benefit for most of the people.
